xml.bio: Gloria Ashiya Katuka is a Ph.D. student advised by Dr. Kristy Boyer in the Department of Computer & Information Science & Engineering at the University of Florida. She currently holds a Masters of Science in Information Systems and Operations Management (MSISOM) at Hough Graduate School of Business on the Information Technology (IT) track, as well as a B.S. degree in Information Systems and a Minor in Leadership from the University of Florida. She will be working with Ph.D. student Alexander R. Webber to apply and test components of the EarSketch project within Alachua County public school systems, where she is currently working on a platform for providing access to Coding and IT skills to minority middle and high school students.
